intro: Canthium lasianthoides, commonly known as the slender cowcup, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands, and is often found in lowland areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems it inhabits.
